Intro.title: Entrepreneurship in Canada
Intro.subtitle: Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP)
Intro.description: Canada is one of the world’s most attractive destinations for entrepreneurs. Through the Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP), Canadian provinces offer unique pathways for international entrepreneurs to establish or purchase a business and obtain permanent residency for themselves and their families.

whyStartBusiness.title: Why Start a Business in Canada?
points: Stable and growing economy with access to domestic and international markets
Continuous demand for foreign entrepreneurs to boost provincial growth
Strong government and provincial support, including tax incentives, investment opportunities, and solid infrastructure
Clear pathway to permanent residency for applicants and their families

services.title: Our Services for Entrepreneurs
services.description: At Novanest, our services are designed to guide entrepreneurs through every stage of the provincial entrepreneur immigration process — from developing a solid and practical business plan to obtaining provincial nomination and successfully establishing and expanding their business in Canada. Our focus is to make the entire journey clear, strategic, and result-driven.

content: Assessing and selecting the right business based on applicant’s profile
Market research and data collection
Drafting marketing materials and business planning documents
Preparing HR and staffing documents
Developing a management plan
Writing a professional business plan aligned with provincial standards
Preparing financial forms according to SME standards
Collecting required documents and preparing a professional resume
Preparing official templates for required letters
Completing provincial application forms
Preparing and submitting EOI (Expression of Interest) to provinces
Identifying licensed Net-Worth Verifier companies in Canada
Coordinating and obtaining net-worth verification reports
Submitting official applications to provincial authorities
Guidance and preparation for interviews
Applying for work permits for applicants and spouses, and study permits for children
Submitting Permanent Residence applications
Receiving provincial nomination (Nomination Services)
Landing services, including assistance with opening a bank account, obtaining SIN, and other settlement needs
Coverage of government fees

faq.title: Can I participate in the Provincial Entrepreneur Program by starting a business, or is it only for buying a business?
items: The program allows international entrepreneurs to obtain permanent residency in Canada by either starting a new business or buying an existing one in a selected province.

faq.title: What is the difference between provincial and federal programs?
items: Provincial programs are designed to meet the economic needs and employment opportunities of each province. The requirements and minimum investment may differ from federal programs.

faq.title: Which provinces are currently popular for starting a business?
items: Popular provinces include: - British Columbia (Vancouver) - Ontario (Toronto) - New Brunswick

faq.title: What are the eligibility requirements?
items: Applicants usually need to: - Have managerial experience or business ownership - Be able to invest in the selected province - Meet minimum English or French language requirements (around IELTS 4)

faq.title: What is the minimum investment required?
items: The amount varies by province, typically between CAD 100,000 and 300,000 for starting or buying a business.

faq.title: Is a language certificate required?
items: Yes, a minimum English or French proficiency of CLB 4 is required.

faq.title: Can my family come with me?
items: Yes, your spouse can accompany you with an Open Work Permit, and your children can study free of charge.

faq.title: What types of businesses are accepted in different provinces?
items: Each province has specific economic needs. Typically, businesses that create jobs and economic growth are preferred, such as: - Local services - Retail stores and restaurants - Technology and digital businesses

faq.title: Is it mandatory to continue working in the same business after obtaining permanent residency?
items: Until you receive your Nomination and PR, the business must remain active. After receiving PR, there are no strict restrictions.

faq.title: How long does it take to receive permanent residency after starting a business?
items: Typically, it takes 6 to 20 months, depending on the province and processing times.

faq.title: Is it possible to pay the investment in installments?
items: Yes, most provinces allow gradual investment payments or staged entrepreneurial support.

faq.title: What factors may lead to an application being refused?
items: - Lack of managerial or business experience
- Failure to meet investment and employment requirements

faq.title: Can my children study for free in Canada?
items: Yes, your children can attend public schools and universities in Canada free of charge.
